de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.control

Class ConnectionWatch

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.TimerTask
      • de.ovgu.softwareprojekt.control.ConnectionWatch
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class ConnectionWatch
extends java.util.TimerTask
    This class handles checking the connection age. It schedules itself. You may not schedule this class by yourself, call start().

    It can be used in active mode with the constructor ConnectionWatch(NetworkDevice, TimeoutListener, CommandConnection, ExceptionListener), where connection checks will be sent and onCheckEvent() must be called when the remote responds.

    It can also be used in passive mode with the constructor ConnectionWatch(NetworkDevice, TimeoutListener, ExceptionListener). No network requests will be sent, but onCheckEvent() must be called when a connection check is requested and has been answered.

      Callback interface for timeouts

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private static boolean CONNECTION_TIMES_LOG
      Set this variable true to print the round trip times to System.out
      private static long MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAY
      If the time between connection check requests exceeds this time, the connection is deemed dead.
      private java.util.Timer mConnectionCheckTimer
      This timer is used for scheduling the "still-alive" requests to our client
      private ExceptionListener mExceptionListener
      Callback for exceptions we could not gracefully handle
      private boolean mIsActiveMode
      True if we are in active mode (eg sending requests)
      private boolean mIsStarted
      True if the timer is currently scheduled
      private long mLastCheckEventTimestamp
      This is the second of the two timestamps for checking the delay between request and answer.
      private long mLastRequestTimestamp
      This is the first of two timestamps used to keep check of the delay between sending the request for a connection check and receiving the answer for it.
      private CommandConnection mOutConnection
      The command connection used for sending the connection check requests
      private NetworkDevice mRemote
      This ConnectionWatch watches the connection to this remote
      private NetworkDevice mSelf
      Network device identifying ourselves
      private ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener mTimeoutListener
      Callback for connection timeouts

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      private void activeModeIteration()
      This runs a single iteration of the active mode:
      Check whether the client answered within MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAYms if it did, send next ConnectionAliveCheck if not, notify mTimeoutListener
      void close()
      Stops operations, no more requests will be sent after this, and no more checks will be executed.
      void onCheckEvent()
      This function is used to notify the watch of a new interaction with the communication partner.
      private void passiveModeCheck()
      This runs the passive mode check, that is it checks whether the last check event occurred less than MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAY ms in the past.
      void run()
      This is periodically called since we scheduled ourselves as a TimerTask in start()

        private static final long MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAY
        If the time between connection check requests exceeds this time, the connection is deemed dead.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • mLastRequestTimestamp

        private volatile long mLastRequestTimestamp
        This is the first of two timestamps used to keep check of the delay between sending the request for a connection check and receiving the answer for it. It keeps track of the last time we sent a connection check request

      • mLastCheckEventTimestamp

        private volatile long mLastCheckEventTimestamp
        This is the second of the two timestamps for checking the delay between request and answer. It keeps track of the last client response time.

      • mTimeoutListener

        private final ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener mTimeoutListener
        Callback for connection timeouts

    • Constructor Detail

      • ConnectionWatch

        public ConnectionWatch(NetworkDevice self,
                       ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener timeoutListener,
                       CommandConnection outConnection,
                       ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
        Create a new active ConnectionWatch. After start() was called, ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener.onTimeout(long) may be called if a timeout is detected. Call onCheckEvent() whenever you receive a connection check response.
        Parameters:
        timeoutListener - callback for timeout notifications
        exceptionListener - callback for exceptions
        self - network device identifying the local network entity
        outConnection - this connection will be used to request connection checks

      • ConnectionWatch

        public ConnectionWatch(NetworkDevice self,
                       ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener timeoutListener,
                       ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
        Create a new passive ConnectionWatch. After start() was called, ConnectionWatch.TimeoutListener.onTimeout(long) may be called if a timeout is detected. No network requests will be sent. Call onCheckEvent() whenever you receive a connection check.
        Parameters:
        timeoutListener - callback for timeout notifications
        exceptionListener - callback for exceptions
        self - network device identifying the local network entity

    • Method Detail

      • start

        public void start()
        Start operations. This will begin sending connection check requests after a short delay.

      • setRemote

        public void setRemote(NetworkDevice remote)
        Set the remote this connectionwatch should watch
        Parameters:
        remote - the target of the connection this watch watches

      • activeModeIteration

        private void activeModeIteration()
        This runs a single iteration of the active mode:
        Check whether the client answered within MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAYms
        • if it did, send next ConnectionAliveCheck
        • if not, notify mTimeoutListener

      • passiveModeCheck

        private void passiveModeCheck()
        This runs the passive mode check, that is it checks whether the last check event occurred less than MAXIMUM_CLIENT_RESPONSE_DELAY ms in the past.

      • run

        public void run()
        This is periodically called since we scheduled ourselves as a TimerTask in start()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Specified by:
        run in class java.util.TimerTask

      • close

        public void close()
        Stops operations, no more requests will be sent after this, and no more checks will be executed. Does not close its command connection!

      • onCheckEvent

        public void onCheckEvent()
        This function is used to notify the watch of a new interaction with the communication partner.

      • started

        public boolean started()
        Get the running state of this connection watch
        Returns:
        true if the watch is running (eg its timer has been scheduled)
